PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a prominent topographical summit located on Blue Ridge within Henry W. Coe State Park, just east of Morgan Hill, California. Because
is the highest point on Blue Ridge and under 10 miles from the park's headquarters, it makes

an ideal destination for day hikers. There are two ways to reach the summit, one by trails and one by a combination of trail and fire road. The fire road route leads you almost directly up Blue Ridge to

and is affectionately nicknamed "The Shortcut". This road rises roughly 1,500 feet (457.2 m) in 1.3 miles (2.1 km) giving it an average grade of 22%. To better understand this incline, most paved roads never exceed an 8% grade in California.
